channel.title: Project Primative. (Based on first Server Ever.)
channel.description:
Well I thought of this tonight. The first server ever, Winterloves has just about nothing in it. It's much harder to code because you need so many methods to do normal tasks in more recent server. It has no npcs, no object spawning, no correct bonuses, no attacking and just about nothing works. Unless it is added ofcourse.
Current lines in client.java: 2554
List of Supporters:
Things I've Done: Got Objects Fully Working and have spawned some.
Currently Fixing/Adding: NPCs - Hard one :o
Going to Hopefully Achieve Tommorow: Magic Attacking Range Bonuses Correct Wearing Adding Beards Spawn Some Objects
If anyone can make a sig for the dev what is in this method will happen.
public void rewardTheHelpful(string reason, int amount) { string reason = ""; int repPower = 3; int amount = repPower; p2.rewardTheHelpful("Thanks for the help", amount); }
and the rewardTheHelpful method will be used on the helpful and people who post suggestions.

item.title: Project Primative. (Based on first Server Ever.)
item.dc:creator: @javaNoob javaNoob()
item.description:
@javaNoob wrote:

Oh Noes! PIERATS!:

Your a decent coder so ill tell you this: Dont bother. Try and start from scratch using wL’s as a rough guide. Otherwise it will not be any more secure than the other servers tbh. Look how easilly the servers crumbled to the SYI attack due to thier poor client management. Its a sign that they tood t be rewrote from scratch =] wL only meant his source to be used as a demo, not to be developed on.

Idc much i just want to base it on something really primative. So I do all the work and the server will be 100% mine.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Primative. (Based on first Server Ever.)
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

if you are making it from scratch, pleeease use object orientation in it. Not like the current ones. Example, make a BaseSkill class that contains the basic Skill related functions, a BaseItem class that contains the basic item properties, a Quest Class perhaps, etc. Do NOT bloat the client.java with millions of lines code like some fucking moron.

Read full topic
